title: Can We please do something about this bull****?
body:
How can Riot go 5 years, and make over a billion dollars, and _still_ not give us any recourse against this cancer?

It happens to everyone, and every troll knows there's nothing you can do about it. You either dodge, or hope they are bluffing. If youre in a series, better hope someone else is feeling generous enough to dodge for you. When this happens(about every 3 to 4 games) I dont get mad at the lowlife, I get mad at Riot for making me a prisoner to these people.

You cant report people in champ select, you cant kick them, you cant mute them. The only option is to take a screenshot and send it to Riot, and hope they feel like doing something about it. Even if they do, you will never even know.

Of course, zero people from Riot will respond to this. Responding to complaints about well known issues means acknowledging them, and that means you actually have to do something about it, or risk even worse PR.

replies.body:
Solution:
Team builder-Draft Ranked

Basically just select your role, then wait in queue, go into a Draft just like normal in random spots(ADC could be at the top, top could be in the middle, mid could be at the bottom, just totally random) and you can see if they're on your team who's going where, and then they can pick their role. People could still troll or go off-meta but for people who aren't smurfing and trying to lose to troll, anyone who will troll if they don't get a lane will be out of the picture through this.

Draft would allow for picking masteries, champions, runes, and so on based on the enemy and ally team comp, yet would still allow off-meta picks, and keep from abusing the system by punishing someone for doing so, though unfortunately there will still be trolls, but there are now, so there isn't much you can do.
If Riot implements team builder for ranked, then they actually have to address the issue of almost no one wanting to support ever.

> If Riot implements team builder for ranked, then they actually have to address the issue of almost no one wanting to support ever.

Interesting question for you: Do you think that there's a possibility that when presented with the option of a faster queue time, it would encourage more players to explore the support role in ranked?

As a support/jungle main myself, I'm honestly curious as it's something that initially influenced my role selection when Team Builder first came out. As a result, I'm finding an extraordinary amount of pleasure in supporting the hell out of my team :).

But wait, what if it's {{item:3724}} {{champion:81}} mid, or {{champion:429}} bot? Then we need point and click cc... crap. Gotta kick that {{champion:68}} top since they can jump off of Equalizer and hope we get someone like {{champion:57}} or at least {{champion:59}}, I'm in my promos and can't afford to lose this one.

I think queue times would grow very high as champions the owner didn't like kept joining - coupled with the pressure to win. I'm not sure there's a way around this that doesn't have a significant tradeoff.

It's not a viable game mode, let alone solution to the problem of trolls.

Zwill... You da man! I started playing Leona support because of the faster queue times and I've been playing support/jungle ever since. Playing support teaches you a LOT you can implement in other lanes and jungle. Like warding, freezing, setting up ganks, initiating fights and basic teamwork which I believe is heavily important in a game. I think if you ever want to be a better league player, learn support. I know sometimes you get very toxic and self involved ADCs but if you do manage to get an ADC with half a brain you'll find the experience a lot more enjoyable than other lanes. Of course in my opinion you should start with Leona as well. She's nice and tanky so you have a lot of survivability if you mess up. She's easy to learn. Her passive is great for support. Her W boost to your armor and MR is pretty neat. Her ultimate allows her to be pretty amazing in 5v5s and her initiate is a LOT of fun (read stun for days).

TL; DR: Yes. Make people start playing support. It should improve overall gameplay quality by raising skill level and map awareness. Sona/Leona are a great place to start. And if you can Nami well then you're awesome! :D

Team Builder is awesome for supports. 

Problem is, ranked games are different. 

Supports are forced to go bot lane with a player whose role pretty much forbids him from buying defensive items early. And also being particularly squishy, and most players (in lower elos) absolutely refuse to buy wards or even use their trinket.

So...yeah. Support mains have to deal with all kinds of toxicity in ranked. Partially because they are in lane with a player who feels unable to buy items necessary to protect himself, and rather relies entirely on the support to make up for his bad positioning or ridiculous ganking pressure from junglers like Rek'sai or Zac, and partially because the support is in the spotlight because they sit in lane with someone else who can watch and scrutinize them all game.

Sure, some supports can be toxic towards marskmen as well, but generally support _mains_ don't behave this way because A) they're used to supporting bad marskmen and B) they are usually genuinely good people that pick the role they picked because they like helping people in real life and they prefer the strategic map control vision game that supports play to the PVE last hit war of top, mid or marksmen.

So that's why support is a role people avoid like the plague in ranked. Because picking support in ranked invites marksmen to be toxic and flame you all game.
Let me tell you something, You should NEVER play a role because of a faster queue. You should enjoy that role and want to play what you're playing.

Supports are sort of the unsung hero in the game when they're played right. If you look at LCS games, you'll often see the supports placing good wards to help with the vision for the team as a whole, and even helping the top laner at the right opportunities (just because you're support doesn't mean you should always be bot. Main reason for the duo bot lane in the first place is to help contest drag...but what if drag is already on timer?).

Yes, they are generally not powerful in the sense that they'll oneshot, destroy, pentakill, etc. the enemy team, but a lot of good supports can be used to cc and enemy to prevent the enemy from making a move (Thresh Q), heal your teammmates (Sona E and Soraka W), saving your teammates (Thresh W), pulling an enemy that's out of position for the team to kill (Blitz Q).

In the end, a good support is able to do a lot more than just feed the team's carry early game. In fact, some supports can go for a poke comp and decimate late-game, not all are "weak" (Lux support, Vel'koz support...while not necessarily "meta" picks, they can be insanely effective when played right). Just like jungling is completely different from laning, it's really just a matter of playing in a non-traditional sense rather than the classic "let's build up to be able to completely decimate them" kind of thing.
Try nautilus or alistar support with ignite, wait till level 3, and then go in with adc
Supports have damage, I don't know what you're talking about.

Support mains or anyone who ends up in that role:

You have to deal with an exceptionally squishy teammate whose entire role revolves around not building any defensive items, or otherwise they are useless to your team.  Even a pure damage Mage builds items that add defensive stats.  Furthermore, this type of champion is intentionally handicapped (or so Riot says) so you must babysit them if you ever wanted them to be useful.

You must spend your hard earned gold on a subpar health item to provide vision for your lane.  Your lane buddy will then face check every bush that is not warded and your other teammates will not purchase their trinket upgrade.  They will also complain you don't have the entire map lit up, as if you actually could do that.

You cannot support anyone else because people and Riot expect the Support to solely babysit the Marksman.  Not a Marksman.  The Marksman.  The role that is always set in stone and subtly enforced by Riot Games.  Should you attempt to support someone else, maybe because you have a bad Bottom Lane Marksman, or an abusive one at that, your other three teammates will bitch and moan about the person who Refuses to Communicate.

--------

As for your question, Zwill, new players start out playing the game as an aggressive, Creep Scoring, type of person.  They don't get taught how to support anyone, and for a long time, they will simply be sharing the lane, rather than supporting anything (The fifth player who would've been the jungler does the exact same thing at Top Lane).

You don't really find many Support _Mains_ at the lower leagues for this exact reason.  You find people who end up as Supports, though.

And why?  The Support role is ALL and ONLY about babysitting someone for the first half of the game, 99.9999% of the time a Marksman.  The second half of the game, they hang around the team and don't really do much else outside team fights.  The only Supports I see that might not have a Marksman as their lane buddy are pre-made groups.  Why?  Because people bitch if this is not the case.  I don't care how much you push the "don't report for off meta" stipulation, people whine and moan if the support does not fulfill these things and babysits the Bot Lane Marksman.

Thee role itself is pretty damn mundane for anyone who is not a true, blue, dedicated support main.  Simply put, it's not very fun to rely on passive gold income and babysit a person who is more often than not, stupid AND deliberately fragile.  Getting yelled at and harassed for not building specific items or lighting up the whole map is not something people like.  Support is like a damned minigame in the game.

I don't care how it's done, but I'll take damage reductions across the board on the Support role if I could influence other lanes, or provide map pressure, or long range utility.  I'd be even more happy if the Sightstone was considered an Essential/Recommended item for EVERY champion.  Sightstone roaming bruiser or supportive Marksman my foot.  Sightstone Teemo ... Do people realize some "Supports" (official, "meta", or off meta) are so squishy that if they go near ward dropping range, they can be insta-gibbed, even with a Sightstone?  Others are actually harmed by building health, which derpy dippity do, the Sightstone is built from a health item.
